questions.question: 1. The following values are inserted into the binary search tree in order. Print the inorder traversal of the resulting tree: [6, 3, 9, 1, 10, 8, 7, 2, 5, 4]

explanations.a: Incorrect: This is the insertion order, not the inorder traversal of the resulting BST.
explanations.b: Correct: The inorder traversal of a binary search tree always produces the elements in sorted order, regardless of the insertion sequence.
explanations.c: Incorrect: This sequence does not represent a valid inorder traversal of any BST with these elements.
explanations.d: Incorrect: This sequence does not represent a valid inorder traversal of any BST with these elements.

questions.question: 2. Which of the following statements about uniquely determining a binary search tree is correct?

answers.d: Inorder traversal alone is not sufficient because it is always sorted for a BST. We need one additional traversal (preorder or postorder) to determine the tree structure.

explanations.a: Incorrect: Inorder traversal of a BST is always sorted, so it doesn't uniquely identify the tree structure.
explanations.b: Incorrect: Postorder traversal alone cannot uniquely determine a BST without additional information.
explanations.c: Incorrect: Preorder traversal alone cannot uniquely determine a BST without additional information.
explanations.d: Correct: Inorder traversal of a BST is always sorted, so we need one additional traversal to determine the tree structure.

questions.question:
3. Which of the following is the resultant tree given the following sequence of insertions:
5, 10, 4, 1, 3, 8, 6

explanations.a: Correct: Following the BST insertion algorithm with sequence [5, 10, 4, 1, 3, 8, 6] produces this tree structure.
explanations.b: Incorrect: This tree structure does not match the result of inserting the given sequence into a BST.
explanations.c: Incorrect: This tree structure does not match the result of inserting the given sequence into a BST.
explanations.d: Incorrect: This tree structure does not match the result of inserting the given sequence into a BST.
